gurmukhi: iSv ky ds sY gn jIq ley iris so puin l`Ck j`C sMGwry ] rwCs qyeIs lwK hny kib sXwm Bny jm Dwm isDwry ]
transliteration: Shiv Ke Das Sai Gad Jeet Lae Ris(i) So Poun(i) Lachchhak Jachchh Sanhdare|| Raachhas Teees Laakh Hane Kabi Syaam Bhane Jam Dhaam Sidhaarre||
translation: Conquering the ten hundred ganas of Shiva, the king killed one lakh Yakshas; he killed twenty-three lakh demons who reached the abode of Yama;

gurmukhi: sRI biRjnwQ kIE ibrQI bhu dwrk ky qn Gwau pHwry ] dÍwds sUr inhwr inSyS DnyS jlyS pSÍyS pDwry ]1577]
transliteration: Sribrijnaath Keeo Birthibahu Daarak Ke Tan Ghaao Prahdare|| Dvaadas Soor Nihaar Nishesh Dhanesh Jalesh Pashvesh Padhdare||1577||
translation: He deprived Krishna of his chariot and wounded Daruk, his charioteer; seeing this spectacle, the twelve Suryas, Chandra, Kuber, Varuna and Pashupatnath fled away.1577.

gurmukhi: bhuro AwXuq gj mwrq BXo pun qIs hjwr iris GwXo ] C`qIs lwK su p`qX hny ds lwK sÍwrn mwr igrwXo ]
transliteration: Bahuro Aayout Gad Maarat Bhyo Poun Tees Hajaar Ris(i) Ghaayo|| Chhattees Laakh Su Pattya Hane Das Laakh Svaaran Maar Giraayo||
translation: Then the king knocked down many horses and elephants and also thirty thousand charioteers; he killed thirty-six lakh soldiers on foot and ten lakh horsemen;

gurmukhi: BUpq l`C hny bhuro dl j`C pRq`Cih mwr BjwXo ] dÍwds sUrn gXwrh rudRn ky dl kau hin kY puin DwXo ]1578]
transliteration: Bhoopat Lachchh Hane Bahuro Dal Jachchh Pratachchhah(i) Maar Bhajaayo|| Dvaadas Sooran Gyaarah Rudran Ke Dal Kau Han(i) Kai Poun(i) Dhaayo||1578||
translation: He killed on lakh kings and caused the army of Yakshas to run away; after killing the twelve Suryas and eleven Rudras, the king fell upon the army of the enemy.1578.

gurmukhi: swT hjwr hny bhuro Bt j`C su l`C keI iqh Gwey ] jwdv l`C kIey ibrQI bhu j`Cn ky qn l`C bnwey ]
transliteration: Saath Hajaar Hane Bahuro Bhat Jachchh Su Lachchh Kaitih Ghaae|| Jaadav Lachchh Keee Birthibahu Jachchhan Ke Tan Lachchh Banaae||
translation: After killing sixty thousand warriors, the king knocked down one lakh Yakshas; he deprived one lakh Yadavas of their chariots and made the Yakshas his target;

gurmukhi: pYdl lwK pcws hny purjy purjy kr BUm igrwey ] Aaur hny blvwn kiRpwn lY jo ieh BUp ky aUpir Awey ]1579]
transliteration: Paidal Laakh Pachaas Hane Purje Purje Kar Bhoom Giraae|| Aur Hane Balvaan Kridaan Lai Jo Eh Bhoop Ke Oopar(i) Aae||1579||
translation: He scattered fifty lakh soldiers on foot in fragments on the earth; instead of them, the warriors who attacked the king with their swords, he killed them all.1579.

gurmukhi: qwau dY mUC duhUM kh BUpiq sYn mY jwie inSMk prXo ] pun lwK suAwr hny bil kY sis ko riv ko AiBmwn hrXo ]
transliteration: Taao Dai Moondhh Duhoon Kah Bhoopat(i) Sain Mai Jaae Nihank Daryo|| Poun Laakh Sooaar Hane Bal(i) Kai Sas(i) Kai Sas(i) Ko Rav(i) Ko Abhimaan Daryo||
translation: The king, twisting his whiskers, fearlessly fell upon the army; he again killed one lakh horsemen and shattered the pride of Surya and Chandra; even with a single arrow, he knocked down Yama on the ground;

gurmukhi: jm ko sr eyk qy fwr dXo iCq sXwm BnY nhI nYku frXo ] joaU sUr khwvq hY rn mY sBhU niRp KMf inKMf krXo ]1580]
transliteration: Jam Ko Sar Ek Te Daar Dayo Chhit Syaam Bhanai Nahinaik(u) Daryo|| Jooo Soor Kahaavat Hai Ran Mai Sabh-hoo Nrip Khanndnikhannddaryo||1580||
translation: He did not become fearful even slightly; those who called themselves heroes, the king chopped them into bits.1580.

gurmukhi: rn mY ds l`C hny pun j`C jlwiDp ko Bt l`Ck mwrXo ] ieMdR ky sUr hny Agny kib sXwm BnY su nhI niRp hwrXo ]
transliteration: Ran Mai Das Lachchh Hane Poun Jachchh Jalaadhip Ko Bhat Lachchhak Mdaryo|| Indra Ke Soor Hane Agne Kabi Syaam Bhanai Su Nahinrip Hdaryo||
translation: He killed in the war ten lakh Yakshas and about a lakh warriors of Varuna; he also killed innumerable warriors of Indra and did not suffer defeat;

gurmukhi: swqk kau muslIDr kau bsudyvh kau kir mUrC fwrXo ] Bwj gXo jm Aaur scIpiq kwhU n hwQ hQXwr sMBwrXo ]1581]
transliteration: Saatak Kau Mousleedhar Kau Basudevah Kau Kar(i) Moondachh Ddaryo|| Bhaaj Gado Jam Aur Sacheepat(i) Kaahoo Na Haath Hathyaar Sanbhdaryo||1581||
translation: He made Satyaki, Balram and Vasudev unconscious; Yama and Indra, without taking up their weapons, fled away from the battlefield.1581.
